## Problem 1

```{r problem1}

# Install the Palmer Penguins package
#install.packages("palmerpenguins")

# Load the dataset
data("penguins", package = "palmerpenguins")
penguins

## The `penguins` dataset contains data on various measurements of penguins, including variables like `species`, `island`, `bill_length_mm`, and `flipper_length_mm`. 
## The dataset has `r nrow(penguins)` rows and `r ncol(penguins)` columns.
## The mean flipper length is `r mean(penguins$flipper_length_mm, na.rm = TRUE)` mm.


## Scatterplot
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(penguins, aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = flipper_length_mm, color = species)) +
  geom_point() +
  ggtitle("Scatterplot of Flipper Length vs Bill Length")
ggsave("scatterplot_penguins.png")

```
**Answer: The `penguins` dataset contains data on various measurements of penguins, including variables like `species`, `island`, `bill_length_mm`, and `flipper_length_mm`. The dataset has `r nrow(penguins)` rows and `r ncol(penguins)` columns. The mean flipper length is `r mean(penguins$flipper_length_mm, na.rm = TRUE)` mm.**


## Problem 2

```{r problem2}

library(dplyr)

set.seed(123)

# Create a data frame
df <- data.frame(
  numeric_var = rnorm(10), 
  logical_var = rnorm(10) > 0, 
  character_var = as.character(letters[1:10]), 
  factor_var = factor(rep(c("Level1", "Level2", "Level3"), length.out = 10))
)

# Attempt to take the mean
mean_numeric <- mean(df %>% pull(numeric_var))
mean_logical <- mean(df %>% pull(logical_var))
mean_character <- mean(df %>% pull(character_var))  # Does not work
mean_factor <- mean(df %>% pull(factor_var))        # Does not work

# Convert the variables
as.numeric(df$logical_var)
as.numeric(df$character_var)
as.numeric(df$factor_var)


```
